meaningMnemonic:
過ぎる means "to pass," and 過ごす is <vocabulary>to pass time</vocabulary>.

過ごす refers to how you live through or experience your time. So it usually needs some extra context when you use it, like what you do while passing time, who you pass it with, or what was it like. Check out the collocations and context sentences to get a better grasp of this word!
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as  過ぎる. If you know it, it's OK <vocabulary>to pass time</vocabulary> relaxing for a bit! If you don’t know it, maybe it's good <vocabulary>to spend time</vocabulary> reviewing…
